title: Remove all authentication and connection/canister UX so app opens directly

requirements.summary: Remove all user-facing authentication and verification UI so the app is immediately accessible without any login/verification steps.
acceptanceCriteria: No screen, modal, banner, or section prompts the user to enter a CTR ID or access code.
No screen, modal, banner, or section prompts the user to enter email/password.
No face verification UI is shown or required anywhere in the app.
There is no Internet Identity sign-in button or login prompt shown anywhere in the app.
User can open the app in a fresh browser session and immediately see the main app content without interacting with any authentication UI.

file_operations.description: Remove any rendered auth-status / sign-in related UI by turning this component into a no-op (render null) and ensure it does not display Internet Identity or any login status controls.
Eliminate face authentication UX by making this component render nothing (or a non-blocking placeholder that does not request camera/verification), ensuring no face verification UI is shown.
Remove email/password sign-in UI implementation file so it cannot be surfaced anywhere in the app.
Remove sign-in options UI to prevent any future login prompts from being rendered.
Remove third-party auth dialog UI so no auth-related dialogs can be displayed.
Eliminate CTR connection UI by making this component a no-op (render null) and ensuring it does not prompt for CTR ID / access code.

requirements.summary: Remove any auth/connection-based gating and ensure all primary sections are accessible immediately on load.
acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the app shows a primary section (not a login/connection/auth screen).
Navigation menu contains only main sections (Stocks & Funds, Withdrawal, Customer Support) and none related to login/connection/auth/verification.
All main sections render and are usable without requiring any identity/CTR/access-code step.

file_operations.description: Ensure the initial render always shows main application content (Stocks & Funds / Withdrawal / Customer Support) and does not conditionally switch to any login/connection/auth screen under any state.

Confirm navigation contains only the three primary sections (Stocks & Funds, Withdrawal, Customer Support) and remove/avoid any auth/connection/verification items or conditional gating tied to identity/connection state.
Remove the login/connection section file to prevent routing/rendering to any dedicated login/connection screen.

requirements.summary: Remove CTR/access-code validation enforcement from the UI so no allowlist checks can block access or show CTR/access-code validation errors.
acceptanceCriteria: No code path in the UI blocks access based on `validateCtrId` or `validateAccessCode` checks.
No user-facing error messages referencing CTR ID or access code validation appear during normal app usage.

file_operations.description: Remove CTR ID and access-code allowlist enforcement by deleting the `validateCtrId` and `validateAccessCode` validators (or converting them into permissive no-op validators that always return valid without CTR/access-code-specific error messages), ensuring the UI cannot gate access based on these checks.

requirements.summary: Remove canister/connection configuration UX (banners, offline notices, settings panels) so users are not asked to configure canister IDs or connection state.
acceptanceCriteria: No connection/config/offline/reachability banners or notices are displayed anywhere in the app UI.
There is no visible UI that asks the user to configure or validate a canister ID.

file_operations.description: Eliminate backend configuration banner UX by making this component render null (or otherwise not render any UI), ensuring no canister configuration task is presented to users.
Eliminate backend reachability banner UX by making this component render null (or otherwise not render any UI), ensuring no reachability warnings are displayed to end users.
Eliminate config initialization banner UX by making this component render null (or otherwise not render any UI), ensuring no initialization notices are displayed.
Eliminate offline mode notice UX by making this component render null (or otherwise not render any UI), ensuring no offline notices are displayed.
Remove any connection/canister settings UI by making this panel render null and ensuring it does not expose canister ID configuration to end users.
Keep canister configuration internal-only and non-interactive (no runtime user overrides); ensure this module does not support or imply any user-facing canister configuration flow.
